case_vignette: A 14-month-old African American boy is brought to the emergency department because of fever, lethargy, and lack of appetite for 6 days. The patient’s mother says he fell off the changing table 10 days ago and landed on his left side, which she says has been tender since then. His vital signs include: temperature 38.0°C (100.4°F), blood pressure 85/41 mm Hg, pulse 132/min. Physical examination reveals conjunctival pallor and reduced range of motion at the left hip. C-reactive protein (CRP) is raised. A magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) scan shows signs of infection in the medullary canal of the left femoral bone and surrounding soft tissues. Blood cultures are positive for Salmonella.
question: Which  would most likely confirm the underlying diagnosis in this patient?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Pediatrics and Neonatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been feeling very tired, have a fever, and I'm not feeling like eating much for the past 6 days.
Have you had any recent illness or injury?
Yes, I fell off the changing table 10 days ago and landed on my left side, and it's been hurting since then.
Have you had any recent changes in your appetite or weight?
I've not been feeling like eating much for the past 6 days.
Have you had any recent changes in your sleep patterns?
I've been feeling very tired lately.
Have you had any recent changes in your energy levels or activity level?
Yes, I have been feeling very tired and less active lately.
Have you had any recent changes in your mood or behavior?
I've been feeling lethargic recently.
Have you had any recent changes in your medical history or medications?
Not that I know of.
Have you had any recent changes in your family history?
Not that I'm aware of.
Final Diagnosis: Fatigue and Loss of Appetite due to Concussion.
